trans-unit.source: Replace the battery on a StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Replace the battery on a StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to remove, replace, and maintain the backup battery module on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to remove, replace, and maintain the backup battery module on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Replace the backup battery module on your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Replace the backup battery module on your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The primary enclosure Power and Cooling Module (PCM) on your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device has an additional battery pack.
trans-unit.target: The primary enclosure Power and Cooling Module (PCM) on your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device has an additional battery pack.

trans-unit.source: This pack provides power so that the StorSimple device can save data if there is loss of AC power to the primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: This pack provides power so that the StorSimple device can save data if there is loss of AC power to the primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: This battery pack is referred to as the backup battery module.
trans-unit.target: This battery pack is referred to as the backup battery module.

trans-unit.source: The backup battery module exists only for the primary enclosure in your StorSimple device (the EBOD enclosure does not contain a backup battery module).
trans-unit.target: The backup battery module exists only for the primary enclosure in your StorSimple device (the EBOD enclosure does not contain a backup battery module).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to:

trans-unit.source: Remove the backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Remove the backup battery module

trans-unit.source: Install a new backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Install a new backup battery module

trans-unit.source: Maintain the backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Maintain the backup battery module

trans-unit.source: Before removing and replacing a backup battery module, review the safety information in the <link><linkText>Introduction to StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Before removing and replacing a backup battery module, review the safety information in the <link><linkText>Introduction to StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Remove the backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Remove the backup battery module

trans-unit.source: The backup battery module for your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device is a field-replaceable unit.
trans-unit.target: The backup battery module for your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device is a field-replaceable unit.

trans-unit.source: Before it is installed in the PCM, the battery module should be stored in its original packaging.
trans-unit.target: Before it is installed in the PCM, the battery module should be stored in its original packaging.

trans-unit.source: To remove the backup battery module
trans-unit.target: To remove the backup battery module

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.

trans-unit.source: Under Shared Components, look at the status of the battery.
trans-unit.target: Under Shared Components, look at the status of the battery.

trans-unit.source: Identify the PCM in which the battery has failed.
trans-unit.target: Identify the PCM in which the battery has failed.

trans-unit.source: Figure 1 shows the back of the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Figure 1 shows the back of the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane Of Device Primary Enclosure Modules</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane Of Device Primary Enclosure Modules</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 1 Back of primary device showing PCM and controller modules
trans-unit.target: Figure 1 Back of primary device showing PCM and controller modules

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: PCM 0
trans-unit.target: PCM 0

trans-unit.source: PCM 1
trans-unit.target: PCM 1

trans-unit.source: Controller 0
trans-unit.target: Controller 0

trans-unit.source: Controller 1
trans-unit.target: Controller 1

trans-unit.source: As shown by number 3 in the Figure 2, the monitoring indicator LED on PCM 0 that corresponds to Battery Fault should be lit.
trans-unit.target: As shown by number 3 in the Figure 2, the monitoring indicator LED on PCM 0 that corresponds to Battery Fault should be lit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane Of Device PCM Monitoring Indicator LEDs</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane Of Device PCM Monitoring Indicator LEDs</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 2 Back of PCM showing the monitoring indicator LEDs
trans-unit.target: Figure 2 Back of PCM showing the monitoring indicator LEDs

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: AC power failure
trans-unit.target: AC power failure

trans-unit.source: Fan failure
trans-unit.target: Fan failure

trans-unit.source: Battery fault
trans-unit.target: Battery fault

trans-unit.source: PCM OK
trans-unit.target: PCM OK

trans-unit.source: DC power failure
trans-unit.target: DC power failure

trans-unit.source: Battery healthy
trans-unit.target: Battery healthy

trans-unit.source: To remove the PCM with a failed battery, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Remove a PCM</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To remove the PCM with a failed battery, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Remove a PCM</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: With the PCM removed, lift and rotate the battery module handle upward as indicated in the following figure, and pull it up to remove the battery.
trans-unit.target: With the PCM removed, lift and rotate the battery module handle upward as indicated in the following figure, and pull it up to remove the battery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Removing Battery From PCM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Removing Battery From PCM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 3 Removing the battery from the PCM
trans-unit.target: Figure 3 Removing the battery from the PCM

trans-unit.source: Place the module in the field-replaceable unit packaging.
trans-unit.target: Place the module in the field-replaceable unit packaging.

trans-unit.source: Return the defective unit to Microsoft for proper servicing and handling.
trans-unit.target: Return the defective unit to Microsoft for proper servicing and handling.

trans-unit.source: Install a new backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Install a new backup battery module

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to install the replacement battery module in the primary enclosure of your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to install the replacement battery module in the primary enclosure of your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: To install the battery module
trans-unit.target: To install the battery module

trans-unit.source: Place the backup battery module in in the proper orientation in the PCM.
trans-unit.target: Place the backup battery module in in the proper orientation in the PCM.

trans-unit.source: Press down the battery module handle all the way to seat the connector.
trans-unit.target: Press down the battery module handle all the way to seat the connector.

trans-unit.source: Replace the PCM in the primary enclosure by following the guidelines in <link><linkText>Replace a Power and Cooling Module on your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Replace the PCM in the primary enclosure by following the guidelines in <link><linkText>Replace a Power and Cooling Module on your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After the replacement is complete, access the Management Portal and navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status, and verify the status of the battery to make sure that the installation was successful.
trans-unit.target: After the replacement is complete, access the Management Portal and navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status, and verify the status of the battery to make sure that the installation was successful.

trans-unit.source: If the LED is showing a green status, the battery is healthy.
trans-unit.target: If the LED is showing a green status, the battery is healthy.

trans-unit.source: Maintain the backup battery module
trans-unit.target: Maintain the backup battery module

trans-unit.source: In device, the backup battery module provides power to the controller during a power loss event.
trans-unit.target: In device, the backup battery module provides power to the controller during a power loss event.

trans-unit.source: It allows the StorSimple device to save critical data prior to shutting down in a controlled manner.
trans-unit.target: It allows the StorSimple device to save critical data prior to shutting down in a controlled manner.

trans-unit.source: With two fully charged batteries in the PCMs, the system can handle two consecutive loss events.
trans-unit.target: With two fully charged batteries in the PCMs, the system can handle two consecutive loss events.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, the Hardware Status on the Maintenance page indicates if the battery is malfunctioning or when the end-of-life is approaching.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, the Hardware Status on the Maintenance page indicates if the battery is malfunctioning or when the end-of-life is approaching.

trans-unit.source: The battery status is indicated by Battery in PCM 0 or Battery in PCM 1 under Shared Components.
trans-unit.target: The battery status is indicated by Battery in PCM 0 or Battery in PCM 1 under Shared Components.

trans-unit.source: This page will show a DEGRADED state for end-of-life approaching, and FAILED for end-of-life reached.
trans-unit.target: This page will show a DEGRADED state for end-of-life approaching, and FAILED for end-of-life reached.

trans-unit.source: The battery can report FAILED when it simply needs to be charged.
trans-unit.target: The battery can report FAILED when it simply needs to be charged.

trans-unit.source: If the DEGRADED state appears, we recommend the following course of action:
trans-unit.target: If the DEGRADED state appears, we recommend the following course of action:

trans-unit.source: The system may have experienced a recent power loss or the batteries may be undergoing periodic maintenance.
trans-unit.target: The system may have experienced a recent power loss or the batteries may be undergoing periodic maintenance.

trans-unit.source: Observe the system for 12 hours before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: Observe the system for 12 hours before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: If the state is still DEGRADED after 12 hours of continuous connection to AC power with the controllers and PCMs running, then the battery needs to be replaced.
trans-unit.target: If the state is still DEGRADED after 12 hours of continuous connection to AC power with the controllers and PCMs running, then the battery needs to be replaced.

trans-unit.source: Please <link><linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> for a replacement backup battery module.
trans-unit.target: Please <link><linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> for a replacement backup battery module.

trans-unit.source: If the state becomes OK after 12 hours, the battery is operational, and it only needed a maintenance charge.
trans-unit.target: If the state becomes OK after 12 hours, the battery is operational, and it only needed a maintenance charge.

trans-unit.source: If there has not been an associated loss of AC power and the PCM is turned on and connected to AC power, the battery needs to be replaced.
trans-unit.target: If there has not been an associated loss of AC power and the PCM is turned on and connected to AC power, the battery needs to be replaced.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> to order a replacement backup battery module.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> to order a replacement backup battery module.

trans-unit.source: Dispose of the failed battery according to national and regional regulations.
trans-unit.target: Dispose of the failed battery according to national and regional regulations.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about <link><linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about <link><linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title></link>.
